Articles.Content:
This is a grand tour vessel I built. The plan is to use the attached ketholanders to refuel and some other, more all-purpose landers for doing the actual landings and flag planting.

It's only around 150 parts but I'm getting somewhere around 5 FPS.

WHY!!!!! I can launch a 300 part craft just fine with no lag (soon as terrain unloads). I've had bigger space stations than this.

Note, those are KOSMOS panels there and they are a mod I've had for a while but never really used. Could they be the problem?

Sysyem specs, just in case:

Intel i7 2.2GHz quad core w/hyperthreading

8 GB RAM (1333MHz I think)

NVidia graphics

Windows 7 premium 64 bit

From what I've heard from other builders, lights and solar panels really kill framerate, and it looks like you've got quite a few lights there. Maybe try removing the lights and test the framerate again?
The Kosmos panels lag like crazy on my rig. Also, overuse of struts is usually bad too.

From what I've heard from other builders, lights and solar panels really kill framerate, and it looks like you've got quite a few lights there. Maybe try removing the lights and test the framerate again?

Yes, too many lights can kill FPS. There are ways to counter this in graphics settings and I did since KSP does not yet properly GPU offload.

The thing is not overstrutted and there are only a total of 8 lights on at the moment, just what I need to light up the docking hub.

KOSMOS has caused me nothing but trouble. I think I'm gonna take those off with whackakerbal and replace the drive stage and hab stage.
Also, from your pic, it looks like you might be below 160,000m. If so, there's still a degree of terrain rendering going on.

That usually isn't a problem until I hit at least 200+ parts. Yes, it is set up in a 100km orbit ATM. I don't want to boot it too high because I have to add the main landers and then the auxilary fuel canister for the transfer to Moho (or maybe I should just jump to Eve, top off and Gilly, then jump to Moho and officially initiate my grand tour)
